title: FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT
description:
Call for Applications for the position of a Finance and Administrative Assistant (Nationally Recruited Staff)

position RE-advertised

The International Institute of Tropical Agriculture calls for applications for the recruitment of a dynamic and experienced Administrative and Financial Assistant to support the Alliance of Bioversity International (Alliance Bioversty-CIAT) activities in Cameroon. This position is readvertised for interested candidates to apply and reapply for those who had applied before.

The Finance and Administrative Assistant supports the Finance and Administration Units at the Station, while working in close collaboration with other operation services, to support Alliance Bioversity-CIAT teams; Compliance with IITA procedures is of utmost importance. The Administrative and Financial Assistant will be responsible for providing a variety of specialized tasks, whilst ensuring accurate and timely delivery in compliance with IITA administrative and financial rules and regulations. He/she is also expected to recommend improvements to process delivery and system design.

A – Duties and Responsabilities

Administration management



Responsible for correspondences, preparation of contracts and sending invitations.

Responsible for vehicle fleet (regular maintenance and vehicle usage policies applied)

Responsible for fixed assets management

Take responsibility for the maintenance of all office equipment

Prepare payment request according to internal procedures of the organization.

Coordinate and organize field staff travels

Manage documentation/logistics of Alliance Bioversity-CIAT visiting researchers, scholars and guests ensuring that it is correctly completed and available

Assist with planning of workshops and events


Financial management and accounting



Generate monthly and year-end financial reports for Alliance Bioversity-CIAT

Manage expenses and income for multiple Alliance Bioversity-CIAT projects

Track Cash and Bank Payments

Prepare and track Alliance Bioversity-CIAT related invoices

Verify and ensuring accuracy by checking sources, making necessary calculations and assuring inclusion of all relevant data.

Oversee management of income and expense budgeting, reporting and reconciliation for Alliance Bioversity-CIAT field sites and projects

Assist in year-end closing of accounts, preparation of year-end reports related to prepayment, review project invoices for policy compliance, accuracy and authenticity.

Periodic preparations of expense reports.

Participate in the preparation of annual Audits.

Adhere to the organization’s financial policies and procedures -Procedure Manuals.

Ensure proper filing of Accounting and accounting related documents.

Performs other duties, as required by the supervisor.


B – Qualification

Education:



Must hold at least a bachelor’s degree in Administration, Accounting, Finance or related discipline;


Working Experience: 



Minimum of three (03) years working experience as Finance and Administrative Assistant;

Must have at least one (01) year experience in a well-structured organization (with proven practice of operations using Standard Operating Procedure manual)

Familiarity with NGOs and/or international organisations would be an asset;


Language:



The candidate must communicate fluently in both English and French


C - Key Competences

Core competencies:



Honest, energetic, independent, self-motivation and administratively self-sufficient.

Ability to think out of the box to solve problems.

Excellent communication capabilities (verbal and written skills)

Excellent customer management skills

Discretion as there will likely be sensitive information and figures discussed.

Excellent ability to pay attention to details and accuracy.

The ability to prioritize work.

The ability to work within strict time constraints.


Technical/Functional Skills:

The Administrative and Finance Assistant shall have:



The ability to maintain clear and accurate financial records.

The ability to accurately monitor, record, and balance accounts.

The ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Experience with an Accounting Software system, Any ERP Software will be an advantage.

Proficient in the use of MS Office, specifically good mastery of Excel;

Excellent interpersonal skills

Must be able to work in a multidisciplinary and multicultural team;

The willingness to undertake professional development.


D - Workplace



The incumbent of the position will be based in Yaoundé, Cameroon.


E - Restriction



The position is limited to Cameroonian citizens.


F - Remuneration



A nationally competitive remuneration package will be offered.


G - Equity in employment



IITA encourages applications from women, men, young people who believe they meet the requirements of the position. All applications will be assessed in a fair and objective manner.


H – Application folder

The application file shall include the following documents:



a completed online application form; kindly fill the form in addition to sending your application file available on https://forms.gle/BNznvHi7EJAm8x9m9

a detailed curriculum vitae but NOT exceeding three pages;

a letter of motivation (MAXIMUM of two pages; including the full names of the candidate, their full address, phone number and email address);

a copy of the national identity card;

a copy of the highest academic credential (certificate) and;

a list of three professional referees including their contacts (one of them must be a current or former supervisor of the candidate).


Applications shall be addressed to (e-mail attachments ONLY), latest by July 23rd, 2023 to: 

The Resident Representative

International Institute of Tropical Agriculture in Cameroon

P.O. Box 2008 Yaoundé (Messa)

Tel : (+237) 222237434 ; +(237) 699319747

Email: IITACA-HRS@cgiar.org

Application to the position of: Finance and Administrative Assistant Alliance Bioversity-CIAT

In addition to your application folder sent by email, kindly fill the mandatory form available on https://forms.gle/BNznvHi7EJAm8x9m9  

Only applications received in French or English with a completed online form will be considered and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Community manager
description:
Offre de stage pré-emploi : Community Manager

Parlez-vous couramment les emoji, avez-vous toujours une Story-insta prête et plus de filtres Snapchat que de filtres à café ? Alors, postule et montre-nous tes mouvements insta.

Qui sommes-nous ?

Nous sommes une entreprise basée sur Douala et offrons des services de qualités à nos clients. Pour accroitre notre visibilité et avoir une empreinte sur les RS il va falloir y être présent.  Et c'est là que vous intervenez. Parce que nous recherchons un Community Manager (h/f) pour rejoindre notre équipe.

Cela signifie ?

Vous êtes plutôt un accro à la nouvelle technologie qui soutient activement notre équipe de médias sociaux avec la création de contenu, la planification stratégique et le rapport final. En plus de la création de contenu, la gestion de contenu et la maintenance des données jouent un rôle majeur (booooring, on sait !). Si vous n'êtes pas rebutés par le Meta et diverses applications et vous avez le sens du marketing, nous pouvons vous offrir un cadre à long terme !

Que devez-vous apporter ?

Nous ne nous attendons pas à un doctorat en gestion des médias sociaux. Les nouveaux arrivants ayant une affinité avec les médias sociaux sont également les bienvenus ! Mais important pour nous :



Envie de design

Un penchant pour la narration en mots, en images et en sons (Hello, Instagram Reels !)

Les idées, les idées, les idées


Vos tâches :



S’occupez de nos canaux de médias sociaux 

Répondre aux questions et commenter les avis

Création de contenu : créer du contenu humoristique, innovant et axé sur le groupe cible (en mots et en images). Dans ce contexte, il faudra concevoir également une grande variété de campagnes sur les réseaux sociaux et de campagnes publicitaires payantes.

Gérer du contenu : être responsable du maintien et de la mise à jour du contenu de divers sites Web.

Détecter des tendances : garder un œil sur les tendances des médias sociaux et pouvoir les mettre en œuvre.

Exchange : travailler main dans la main avec les clients et réagir avec souplesse aux nouvelles exigences.


Ce que vous apportez avec vous :



Solides compétences en communication et en relations humaines

Orientation service

La créativité

La passion des réseaux sociaux

Très bon Anglais et Français (parlé et écrit)

Prendre plaisir à prendre des photos/réaliser de petits clips

Une première expérience professionnelle dans l'édition/gestion des réseaux sociaux est un atout, ainsi qu'une connaissance préalable des outils suivants : Facebook Business Manager, Sprinklr, Salesforce, Qualifio, Canva, Wordpress/CMS

Soumettre les documents suivants :



Lettre de motivation adressée à Mme Carine (indiquant pourquoi vous choisir vous plutôt qu’une autre personne).

Curriculum Vitae avec photo ;


Les dossiers complets devront parvenir par courrier électronique à l'adresse suivante: info@dogspa-cm.com

Mentionner dans l’objet : Candidature au poste de ‘Community Manager’.

Numéro à contacter : +237 691874415

title: Research Assistant
description:
JOB VACANCY

Job Title: Research assistant

Location: Douala

Duration: Part time Closing

Expected start Date: 01st August, 2023

ABOUT CLEAN AIR AFRICA

CLEAN-Air (Africa) is a partnership between public health experts from the UK, Ghana, Kenya and Cameroon, aiming to provide policy-relevant evidence to address the global challenge of lack of access to clean household energy for the 4 billion people of the World’s population.

JOB SUMMARY

In this position, you will play a key role in monitoring clinical and community studies to ensure compliance with procedures and protocols. You will work under the supervision of principal investigator who leads research projects. You are responsible for assisting him in a number of tasks that support the research activities. The research assistant is responsible for meticulous data management for multiple ongoing research studies, including: database development and maintenance, initiating processes for regular database updates and quality control functions, data abstraction, interpretation and organization.

RESEARCH ASSISTANT DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



Conduct literature reviews

Maintain accurate records of interviews, safeguarding the confidentiality of subjects, as necessary

Supervise undergraduate students working on the research project

Summarize project results

Prepare progress reports

Prepare other articles, reports and presentations

Write and contribute to publications

Develop research protocols

Contribute to the design of protocols, which includes the methodology, analysis, quality control and reporting sections for both quantitative and qualitative data.

Develop assessment and evaluation tools

Create presentation slides and posters to help researchers present findings

Conduct data quality assessment in the study databases, generate listing of errors or incoherence, send data queries to study sites and supervise the data correction process

Oversee and coordinate the process from data capture to data sharing

Perform statistical analyses using appropriate statistical tools for planned data presentations and communications related to a given study

Liaise with study coordinator to follow-up data errors, discrepancies, and missing information for ongoing data cleaning

Maintain the integrity, security and data backup of the study database


REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS



Education PhD in biostatistics, Epidemiology or in Public Health Masters in biostatistics, Epidemiology or public health Working experience

Knowledge of research methods.

Minimum 4 years’ experience as research coordinator in a project

Experience in monitoring of biomedical and operational research data is mandatory.

Prior experience in article writing and submitting in peer review journals.

Languages English and French are the working languages for the project. Fluency in oral and written English is obligatory


Additional skills



Self-directed and able to work independently and collaboratively with colleagues

Ability to multitask, prioritize, work under pressure, and manage time efficiently

Excellent teamwork and coordination skills.

Good computing skills, Excel, Word, PowerPoint


ASSESSMENT



Selection of qualified candidates will include an initial review of the CVs of applicants, followed by an interview of pre-selected candidates.


HOW TO APPLY



CV’s should not be more than 3 pages.

Submit your updated CV and letter of motivation to cleanaircameroon@gmail.com latest 17th July, 2023.

 FAIRMED is a Swiss health development organization with a long history in neglected diseases affecting neglected populations. We are passionate experts in NTDs and public health. We believe in local capacities and all our offices and projects in Africa and Asia are managed by local experts. Our organization is quality and credibility certified and we partner with local and international stakeholders. Via neglected diseases we identify our target population and in a comprehensive approach, considering all health-related factors, we break the vicious cycle of disease and poverty. We act on both, the supply and demand side. On the one side, we are close to the communities, know their needs, and capacitate them and on the other side, we strengthen the primary health care systems which is the first access point to health for our communities. Through our programs we locally change the life of the most vulnerable and globally we contribute our share to universal health coverage and to SDGs with their motto ‘leave no one behind’."

JOB SUMMARY

Program Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning, (MEAL) officer will provide technical leadership, oversight, and strategic direction for MEAL activities for FAIRMED projects in Cameroon. Our projects support the National NTD Control Program (for yaws, leprosy, Buruli ulcer, and Leishmaniasis), the Ministry of Health (MOH) to implement activities to strengthen the health system and improve access to primary healthcare services, and the Ministry of Social Affairs to support access to health for the indigenous populations (Baka, Bedzang), and to improve the participation of PWD towards greater respect and promotion of their rights". Under the coordination of the Country Coordinator, supervises and provides technical support to project coordinators and staff, guarantees that staff adheres to schedule, and builds a relationship with all team players in a project. The program MEAL officer will, under the supervision of the country coordinator also have a key role to participate in grant requests and formulate ideas for new projects. The Program MEAL officer will also participate in designing and conducting assessments, operations research, and evaluations to address projects’ needs. The Program MEAL officer will liaise with and support government, local, civil society, and partners to implement monitoring and evaluation activities.

Duties and Responsibilities

Section 1 – Monitoring and Reporting



Ensure and pay specific attention to data quality and use, the protection of participant data, and confidentiality during all monitoring, evaluation, and research implementation and dissemination processes,

Provide monthly feedback on MEAL data in line with project indicators,

Ensure appropriate project reporting meets all demands of both internal and external stakeholders,

Promote and support the dissemination of project information among the projects team.

Established a culture of periodic project reviews including data and log frames reviews,

Train and mentor project staff and implementing partners in monitoring and evaluation methods, tools, and systems.

The program MEAL will be responsible to support project teams in the data collection, processing, data quality assurance, and reporting following project and program MEAL plans.


Section 2 – Evaluation  



Ensure continuous assessment of the relevance, coherence, effectiveness, efficiency, impact, and sustainability of FAIRMED project interventions during the project cycle,

Lead mid-term and end-of-project evaluations in compliance standards and internal procedures,

Support the projects to provide the Ministry of Health with technical assistance to strengthen the country’s DHIS2 for the optimal use of routine DHIS2 data.

Create and operationalize a system for periodic social evaluations and project participants’ evaluations to create a dynamic feedback loop into projects,

Create impact evaluation mechanisms for the projects,

Ensure relevant data is entered into FAIRMED’s MEAL web platform (logalto) which is the organization-wide data management platform designed to capture, analyze, and disseminate project data.


Section 3: Learning



Support the organization in establishing a learning and cross-sharing system within FAIRMED Cameroon and with other FAIRMED MEAL colleagues when the need arises.

Use data to contribute towards strategic decision-making and project planning,

Support and strengthen greater collection, sharing, and use of gender monitoring data, feedback, context analysis, and lessons learned within FAIRMED’s Cameroon program,

Organise lesson-learned workshops or meetings and provide practical recommendations,


Section 4: Organizational



Complies with strategies and procedures governing the program and ensures that the country program is operating at maximum efficiency.

Ensure consistency of indicators across projects with the goal of measuring country program performance and achievements.

Surveys applications for potential employees and assists in the hiring and training process.

Contribute to the project development process to ensure quality of content and integration of FAIRMED project cycle management tools and principles, and alignment with FAIRMED programmatic strategy.

Contribute to the preparation and consolidation of the Annual Work Plans to ensure they are aligned with the log frames logic,

Finalize and consolidate the technical reports prepared by the project coordinators and controlled by other colleagues before their transmission within reporting timelines.

Contribute to the identification of opportunities, grants development of new project initiatives to strengthen the FAIRMED program in Cameroon,

Participates in partner meetings and strengthen links with INGOs and/or community stakeholders, existing and potential partner institutions of the projects as well as with the different levels of the Ministries of Health and Social Affairs,


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



Master’s degree in public health, epidemiology, demography, statistics, social sciences, or related field or equivalent experience

Minimum 4+ years of work experience in monitoring and evaluating/program officer, multi-year international health sector development projects.

Proven expertise in quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis methodologies, implementation research approaches, data visualization, and reporting

Demonstrated management, coordination, teamwork, and planning skills with proven ability to function effectively with multiple host-country counterparts in both the public, NGO and private sectors.

Strong technical skills, including the ability to process and analyse data using DHIS2 and one or more statistical software packages, including at least one of the following: SPSS, Epi-Info, Stata, MS Excel,

Experience hiring and supervising personnel and ensuring they acquire the necessary training and skills to meet evolving project needs.

Excellent skills and a proven ability to establish and maintain interpersonal and professional relationships with host-country counterparts, and representatives from other key stakeholders such as NGOs, CSOs, and the private sector.

Demonstrated outstanding leadership, strategic thinking, organizational, team-building, and representational skills.

Excellent verbal, written interpersonal, and presentation skills in French and English will be an added value.

Proficiency in word processing and Microsoft Office

Ability to travel nationally and internationally as needed,

Prior working experience as a Program or project coordinator for some years,

Good organizational and time-management skills

Be an assertive problem solver.

Illustrates the ability to be well-organized and delegate work where appropriate.

Good experience in developing dashboards from databases and data visualisation will be an added advantage.


 HOW TO APPLY

File MUST include:



 Cover letter addressed to the Country Coordinator

CV  including 3 professional references

 Proof of professional experience.


You can apply by sending your application to the following address: recrutementscameroun@fairmed.cm Mentioning “Program MEAL Officer – 062023” in the subject line

title: Field Civil Engineer
description:
JOB ADVERT

Seeking Hard-Working, Dedicated Field Civil Engineer in Cameroon

Innovation: Africa

Background

Innovation: Africa (iA) is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization whose team of dedicated problem solvers work together to bring solar and water technologies to rural communities in Africa. We use solar energy to pump clean water and provide schools, orphanages, and medical clinics with light and refrigeration to store vaccines and medicines. iA has completed over 650 solar, water, and agricultural projects, providing light, clean water, food and proper medical care to more than 3 million people in Ethiopia, Tanzania, Malawi, South Africa, Uganda, Cameroon, Senegal and the Democratic Republic of Congo.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly trained and qualified individual to join our Cameroon team as a Field Civil Engineer based in Garoua. This position works under the supervision of the local Project Manager and is responsible for overseeing iA’s solar water pumping systems, technical implementation, liaison with local solar water contractors and in-house engineers, as well as providing technical support in all sites post completion ensuring that all projects meet iA standard and structural integrity. The Field Civil Engineer will also be responsible for all iA field activities, including identifying and selecting the beneficiaries of our projects, actively engaging in community mobilization and sensitization, establishing and maintaining regular communication with the communities we serve, implementing project-related activities, providing regular reports and ongoing monitoring of the projects. As this is predominantly in-the-field work, candidates should expect frequent travel to the field to identify new projects, oversee the construction and implementation of ongoing projects, and monitor completed projects. 

Reports To: Local Project Manager & Country Director in Israel

Responsibilities



Oversee all field operations related to solar powered water projects, including prospective project search, project construction/implementation, and monitoring and evaluation

Work closely with the local contractor to plan and design all solar water pumping systems, blueprints and implement all civil construction works

Where relevant, work closely with the local contractor to plan, design and implement drip irrigation systems

Oversee technical implementation of all water systems and serve as technical point person for all system designs, water tower construction works, water distribution point construction, structural design analysis and checking materials used during construction

Manage on-site work during all stages of the system construction and installation

Independently assess needs for maintenance work (post-installation) in projects where a malfunction exists 

Maintain regular contact with Innovation: Africa’s engineers in Israel to successfully implement and monitor new solar technologies and remote monitoring systems

Continually monitor the progress of ongoing field installation and maintenance activities

Conduct community technical trainings and sensitization to all iA water and drip system beneficiaries on water management for water and agricultural use

Appropriately sensitize the communities we work with, including establishing project steering committees to maintain the project

Support the Project Manager to manage relationships with municipal officers, local leaders, and international stakeholders 

Send daily updates and regular progress reports to international management team regarding prospective projects, construction and implementation of current projects, and monitor existing projects

Research and implementation of best construction practices and equipment in all iA projects


Qualifications

The ideal candidate is a dedicated team-player with strong interpersonal skills and a background in solar powered water systems. Applicants must have competitive experience in community development and mobilization, as well as experience working with international stakeholders. The candidate must demonstrate a proven passion for working with the community and possess strong detail orientation and problem-solving skills. 

Compensation



Commensurate with experience. 


Requirements



Bachelor’s Degree or professional diploma in Civil Engineering or closely related field with an emphasis on water projects

At least 3 years' experience working with a structural engineering company with vast experience in construction works

Experience supervising civil works in NGO community development projects

Ability to design systems using various design applications; e.g AutoCAD 

Technologically oriented with excellent computer skills, including proficiency in email and Microsoft Office software

Driver’s license

Ability to commit to flexible working hours, including weekends

High proficiency in English and French; both writing and speaking

Ability to relocate to Garoua District

Able to speak local languages of the region and with a good personality


As an international organization, our team works in New York, Israel, and Africa, and is constantly on the move. To maintain close contact despite our travel schedules, we regularly use technology solutions, such as Slack, Zoom and more. The ideal candidate thrives in this type of fast-paced environment and is comfortable working with colleagues in different time zones and continents.  

Application Instructions



Please send your cover letter and CV as a single PDF attachment to cameroon.civil@innovation-africa.odoo.com

The file name should be saved as your full name.

Please include the position and country for which you are applying to work in the subject line of the email “Field Civil Engineer in Cameroon”

description:
Professional Internship in Electrical Engineering

Electram Engineering, a leading firm in the renewable energy industry, is currently seeking Electrical Engineering students or entry-level professionals for our Professional Internship Program. As a company committed to diversity and inclusion, we prioritize female applicants for this program.

Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work alongside our experienced team of engineers, gaining valuable industry knowledge and hands-on experience. Interns will also be responsible for providing support to our engineering team in various projects related to photovoltaic systems and Computer-Aided Electrical designs.

Requirements:



Must be pursuing or have completed a degree in Electrical Engineering.

Should be able to assist professional engineers in the design, assessment, or repair of electrical systems and infrastructure elements.

Strong academic record and technical aptitude.

Passion for renewable energy solutions and eagerness to learn.

Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Preferred:



Knowledge or experience working with photovoltaic systems.

Knowledge or experience with Computer-Aided Electrical designs.


If you meet these qualifications and are interested in joining our team, please submit your resume and cover letter to info@electram.cm

 We look forward to hearing from you!
